Title: Exceptional!
Review: I very highly recommend Thanh Lich Guesthouse. I felt very well attended to from soon after I booked. For example, I received instructions to the guesthouse, unsolicited, shortly after booking, which later helped me orient myself on the taxi ride from the train station to the guesthouse. Given many stories I have heard about taxi scams in Vietnam, this helped to set my mind at ease. When I asked about means by which I could get to the guesthouse and Son My Memorial Park and approximate costs, I received very timely, clear, and useful advice, also setting my mind at ease. I arrived at the guesthouse late at night, around 11pm. When I arrived, one of my gracious hosts was outside greeting me as I exited the taxi. I do not speak Vietnamese, and she did not speak English, but non-verbal communication between the two of us seemed to work very well. She pointed to something written asking for my passport and then immediately took me to my room to show me how everything worked, the fan, air-conditioner, shower, etc. All appliances worked well, and the room was clean, and aesthetically pleasing. I had a view of the river, as well. Water, coffee, and cookies were available in the room for free. I have found during my travels in Vietnam that drinking water, cold water in which to shower/bathe, and air-conditioning have been my three best friends, so I very much appreciated being given drinking water, as I had been primarily buying it to that point. My host checked my understanding and satisfaction (I think) by making a thumbs up, to which I replied in kind. In the morning, I emailed who I believe is the daughter who understands English to ask her to help me book a taxi with the taxi driver I had the night before (he had given me his card) to Son My Memorial Park and then to the train station. In the time it took me to take a shower, my ride was booked. My check out also went smoothly in that more pointing to written text was had. I was given a bottle of water and a hug and was sent on my way. This is a family run business that I think should definitely be rewarded for the familyâ€™s hospitality. I truly felt welcome, not as though I was a business transaction. I am exploring the possibility of bringing students with whom I work in the United States to Vietnam, and if this comes to fruition, my plan will be for all of us to stay at Thanh Lich Guesthouse during our time in Quang Ngai.

Title: Poor value/money ratio.  Rooms not necessarily as advertised.
Review: As many others Western tourists, I came here because this hotel bridges the hotel gap between Quy Nhon and Quang Ngai. It used to be the only hotel far and wide on the major booking sites, but as of October 2018 there are alternatives ! Staff: Very friendly and efficient and the relevant staff (check-in, restaurant) speak English quite well for all those Westerners too lazy to learn a few words of Vietnamese ;-) Restaurant: Very yummy food at surprisingly low prices! Alas, no Gin&Tonic or wine by the glass on the menu. Great service with a smile. Truth in Advertising: My room was sold by a major booking site and was advertised as SEAVIEW bungalow. Yes, if that restaurant building and all those trees were not between me and the ocean I might actually catch a glimpse of it. Given the location and lack of view of the room, the price is outrageously expensive. Hot Water: A continuous-flow water heater provides hot water. Just make sure it's turned ON ;-). WiFi: Very good but suffers from short disruptions occasionally. Room: Comfy bed, quality furniture including work desk, kettle, refrigerator, but lighting is TOO DIM. Beach: Long empty beach with nice water, but waves can be high. Flotsam& jetsam plastic is cleaned off parts of thee beach but not to a level one would desire. Other: The restaurant has a very good sound system, which until 10 pm may be used for Karaoke at an astonishing volume. (more likely on weekends)

Title: Better than expected
Review: We chose Sa Huynh Resort as it worked with our visit to Quang Ngai. The resort is in an odd location, we would say in-the-middle-of-nowhere, really. About 50mins from Quang Ngai (town) and only accessible by car, bus, motorbike or bicycle. (However, there is a train station but we do not know if the train actually stops there). There is nothing around the resort, nothing to attract local customers. We can only assume this location takes full account of a super beach and its a good stop off point while travelling on the N/S Highway. The good points are the pristine gardens and landscaping; excellent restaurant food (Nothing western here) and the quiet. We would have liked loungers on the beach and free beach towels to take full advantage of the beach and a focus on beach cleanliness too. The high season is March (so we were told). Our family and one other were the only long stay residents. Breakfast was ordered each day but on one occasion when three bus loads of local tourists stopped we experienced a splendid buffet breakfast. We thought the rooms were just OK and our children liked the free open space. The swimming pools, one for adults and one for children were not available and the child's pool would have been too deep anyway for our children. Light and dark grey granite stone finishes inside the rooms and outside everywhere takes some time to get used too to. We hired a car one morning to explore the local area. It's a pity there is nothing much to see for tourists. Just down the road the sea salt beds were slowly being phased out and the beaches just starting to be developed for tourists. The sea is a wonderful turquoise colour and the fishing authentic. However, poor planning has made these areas abysmal. On the up side the final bill,accommodation and food and shopping came well below our expectation. Think of this spot as a motel resort and you get the picture.

Title: Great beach resort
Review: We rode here from Da Nang so after 6 or so hours on a bike we were pleased to arrive. Having read some of the reviews I was not sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. We really liked the room it was large and comfortable. Unlike other hotels we have stayed in recently everything worked and worked well!! The air con was so efficient I had to turn it up as I was feeling chilly! The fridge worked and the TV worked, the lights worked - we have had rooms recently where very little worked! The bathroom was great, nice big shower and very clean. The bed was very comfortable not hard like so many we have had in Vietnam. The first thing we did was to dump our bags and then go and jump in the sea, it was so good, clear and warm. After the sea we went for a dip in the pool - there was no one else in it! We ate in the restaurant, the food was ok but to be honest I have had much better street food. It was edible but nothing special. The staff however were lovely, really friendly and helpful. We were only here for a night but loved it. It is in a great location with the sea literally on the doorstep. It's clean and comfortable with good facilities.

Title: Kind of dissapointed
Review: We stayed here only for one night . The room is good enough and very clean but in the bathroom, the tub doesn't have the curtain which made the floor all wet. The resort has two pools, one for the kids and one for adults. The water is hot at night because of the sun which made us felt warm. The breakfast is not that good. They don't have many fruits, only watermelon. When we asked the waitress the take the dishes away but she said she will take them later while she was talking. We are very dissapointed on the restaurent but we like the rooms. Thank you to everyone in Sa Huynh and I hope that waitress can improve herself.

Title: Surprising given the location
Review: Stayed in this hotel as part of a cycling tour in April. We were surprised at the standard of accomodation on offer as it appears that the resort is somewhat out of the way. I understand that during Vietnamese holidays the place is booked out, however when we were there other than our group there was only one other person. The rooms are of a good standard, although getting to some of them with a suitcase can be a bit of an adventure. The beds were comfortable and the room spacious by Vietnamese standards. The only down side for westerners is the small hot water system used, other than that the hotel was clean and of a good standard. The onsite restaurant served a good standard of food for a reasonable cost. The only issue I have with the staff here is the lack of english, however you must remember that you are in Vietnam! The onsite store was a gem and had everything you could possibly require at short notice, I especially liked the bags of the minutature garlic grown in this part of Vietnam. All in all a good hotel in an out of the way place.

Title: I knew it would be good--and it was better.
Review: Sometimes the nature of the bad reviews of a place suggest to me that it'll be great. And so it was. Beautiful grounds, friendly and helpful and smiling staff, good price, right on the beach (with no intervening road), really good food--and ample portions and fast service, the most beautiful and accommodating masseuse anywhere, very comfortable mattress, no karaoke tonight (and this is Saturday). The one thing that the negatives got right was that the pool wasn't chemically treated, but they did it two hours after I arrived, so it'll be good later. Just ask. I might lengthen my stay here.

Title: Just pass by here
Review: First we have to say we didn't stay here, just we went around to have a look while waiting for the bus to Quang Ngai (the bus station is nearby). This is a beach-front resort which is quite spacious and well-maintained. The beach is quite deserted, peaceful but a little bit dirty (some rubbish on the sand). The staff in the resort are quite easy and unconcerned while letting strangers like us step into the resort. Overall, we notice that this is the best place to stay in this area compared to other motels or inns nearby since it has a private beach and better facilities but in terms of safety and price we are not sure.

Title: Worth more than you may think in the first place
Review: Actually being in Sa Huynh, right in the middle of nowhere may sound a little "wild" In fact this destination may fit you very well if you want to be away from everything for a couple of days, and this resort boasts: - excellent bungalows around 40USD with all the amenities (super modern cable TV, A/C, brand new bathroom, etc), furnished with taste, and perfectly quiet and mosquito free! - a very nice horizon swimming pool - with immediate and direct access on the pristine Sa Huynh beach - all this with very decent food and options in a charming restaurant - brought by friendly staff who will try their best to serve you (have not tried their English), though they can be a little slow and sometimes confusing in their way of thinking! I guess all this is especially true when you come with reasonnable expectations. Take Sa Huynh as it is, and enjoy it!!! :)

Title: Horrible- loud music and freeway noise
Review: My girlfriend and I are traveling through Vietnam, wanted to give her a nice night at a resort. We have both traveled around the World, and this was no resort. Title: Perfect relax place during long journey.
Review: Hotel is located just 1km from the main road. We decided to stay here on our way to Dalat. We are traveling on the bicycles so it's a long way. We found that Hotel us place where we could relax and recover. Spacious, clean room and comfortable big bed... Staff was very friendly and welcoming. They speak english so no worries. Breakfast was tasty-variety mostly of asian cuisine but you can find cereals and tost as well. Apart that pho soup and eggs of your choice.

Title: Good basic hotel at a reasonable price
Review: I stayed at this hotel when working at the local refinery and was treated very well by the staff and enjoyed my stay. The choice of food is very broad, both asian and european and the prices are very reasonable. The hotel is quite basic but has all that you need and is comfortable

Title: Beautiful and large hotel
Review: Probably the only good local hotel for foreigners. 10mins from Chu Lai airport. Or 2-3 hours drive from danang. Room is large at the price $45/deluxe room and $90/suite room. But surrounding area, nothing. People who stayed here normally come to Dung Quat for business. Maybe you can visit my lai massacre village. Check in. Out is fast. Breakfast is not so good but not much choice. Only entertainment- Asiana massage.

Title: Wasn't the best
Review: The hotel is beautiful.. massive building. Lovely staff who were very helpful. Bedrooms were very nice. Unfortunatly the food wasnt great and we had no hot water. The hotel was a long journey from the train station and we got a taxi who hadnt a clue where we were going (not ghe hotels fault). We never got to the pool unforunatly but it looked beautiful.

Title: unexpected luxury
Review: The hotel appears new and sports generous marble and luxurious details. It's location appears incongruous, with the typical shanties and farms nearby and then a large modern hotel placed in the middle of it all. The rooms were clean and modern with good air conditioning which was appreciated. The pool complex appeared nice, but unfortunately closed at 6pm, which was just about when I got back to the hotel each day, so we didn't get to swim. The restaurant was good with a western menu which was adequate. Good staff, but English was a little tough for some of them. Prices were very good by western standards, but in line with Vietnamese hotels of this caliber. I will stay here again.

Title: Perfect place to stay in Ly Son
Review: We stayed at the Muong Thanh Hotel for one night and it was just perfect. We got picked up at the port as soon as we arrived and were able to check in immediately. Somehow we were the only guests staying at the hotel that night - but that was actually really nice! We had a delicious lunch especially prepared for us, the pool for us alone to use and a private tour to discover the island. Thuy and Luong were very nice and courteous, they drove us, accompanied us and were fun to be around. In general the whole staff were kind and awfully nice! The rooms are very nice, spacious. The bathroom - separated by a glass wall - is so stylish and very well furnished. Too bad the water in the shower is super hot, l almost got burnt, for the rest: this accommodation is worth every cent!

Title: Best place for accomodation in the island
Review: The newest and most modern hotel in the island. 10 mins ride by taxis from the pier/night market. Title: We felt not welcome...
Review: Except of two friendly girls at the reception we didn't feel welcome from the Hotel staff. When we have seen other staff members they even ignored us and didn't give a hello back. The room was clean and cosy but the lumination was insufficient even by turning on every light. The toilet seat wasn't clean and had urinal drops. The pressure of the water in the shower wasn't strong at all. The Hotel's restaurant was not tasty, the noodle soup tasted like made with an instant noodle package and the staff was unattentive and ignorant. It's a bit sad, because with a more friendly, attentive and professional staff this hotel could be a nice place.

Title: Great Place - on the beach
Review: Love this place! The beach is out front on the other side of pine trees that have hammocks. The beach is clean, plenty of restaurants, taxi stand out front, clean and staff very nice ( little English but no problems). Very good price $85 USD for 3 nights on Agoda. Good running route just west of beach. Beds are comfortable, unlike typical hotel that caters to Vietnamese. Wireless and air con great I was in room 206 which had router outside my door). Can sit on adjacent balcony and see beach and feel ocean breeze. This is not a western resort. This is a comfortable, 2-3 star place, well worth the price. Would love it with kids.

Title: Okay for one night
Review: The staff is friendly and they do speak a bit of English. The room was big, but had a strong smell of moisture and the facilities were not that clean. I was alone in the hotel, so it was very peaceful. Around the hotel you will not find a lot of things to do. There is a wide and long beach, but the water isn't that clear as described in Lonely Planet. My Son memorial and museum are about 3-4 km from there (be careful: wrong location in Google maps!!). So more or less walking distance, it depends on your fitness! Just take the bridge near the hotel, take left and walk through the village to reach the roundabout. Then take the road on the right (3. Exit) and walk about 2 km. The memorial is on the right.

Title: Oase van rust, echt vakantie!
Review: We zijn hier naartoe gegaan op de scooter en hebben hier een paar dagen geslapen. Tijdens ons verblijf hebben we geen toerist gezien en dat was wel even lekker na alle drukke toeristenplekken. Het hotel is schoon, netjes en op een prachtige locatie! Je kijkt uit over een prachtig strand met een heerlijke zee. Enige wat mist is een beetje een goede douche en een ontbijt, maar dat maakt dit hotel er niet veel minder op. Bovendien is het een mooie ervaring om toch meer van het echte Vietnamese leven te zien en om de gedenkwaardige plek van My Lai/Son My te bezoeken.

Title: Comfortable but loud, poor air con, unclean, bad breakfast - definitely not 4 star
Review: The hotel was fine and it did the job - just somewhere to drop our bags while we went to the My Lai memorial (400,000 vnd return taxi). $40 for the night might not seem like much but I am writing this review from a much nicer hotel at $20 a night. It wasn't clean, the towels were very old and a little stained, the shower was a dribble, there was music from the 10th floor until 11pm and again at 6am. It was so loud that it was not possible to sleep. I believe this happens most nights as the floor is dedicated to the music group. Definitely avoid the 9th floor anyway just in case. Breakfast tokens were provided.... Oh boy was that a disappointment. Cold fried dumplings sitting out for god knows how long, chefs sneezing all over the egg station.... Even the rice was disappointing. Carpets and walls were stained... The bed was comfortable, though the air con was so poor that it made it difficult to sleep.

Title: Adequate for Quang Nga but definitely not 4 star

Title: Average business type hotel.
Review: The hotel is pretty average - safe, secure, comfortable enough and the staff try hard (although English is limited) but it is ageing, the internet is dodgy in the rooms and it simply doesn't stand up compared to other 4star hotels even in Vietnam.

Title: Repeat and confirmation of some other reviews
Review: This is an aging hotel that tries to provide adequate service, but leaves a bit to be desired. Of the multiple local hotels I stayed at up the coast of Vietnam, this one had the worst breakfast buffet, as others have noted. On the other hand, at the rooftop restaurant, the dinner was one of the better dinners I had at local establishments. Some local expat Germans were also eating dinner there, so I take that as an additional endorsement. I wonder why they can do such a good job with dinner, but such a poor job with breakfast? Maybe different management/owners for the two (breakfast is on the lobby floor)? On the other hand, the room was adequate...I would say middle of the scale for local hotels I experienced across Vietnam. Everything was provided, the furnishings acceptable, the room spacious, if somewhat basic. I was told the "river view" was once spectacular, but it is now a dried out riverbed...not a view at all. As noted, skip the spa...a dingy place in the parking garage.

Title: Average, equivalent to price
Review: Stayed 1 night with family during our trip through Central of Vietnam. Nice location as it's next to Tra Khuc river which is the famous river. Everything is at average, can't ask for more in such provincial hotel. Good choice of accomodation in town because there are not many good hotels around.

Title: NOT a 4-star hotel
Review: This hotel was booked for us as a part of the package we bought to tour Vietnam, a one night stay. The check-in experience was decent, but the staff spoke little English. Our room was touted as "Deluxe" and non-smoking, but there was nothing deluxe about it. The carpet was well worn out with numerous cigarette burn marks all over the place. It was not vacuumed prior to our arrival either. The wardrobe had holes in the doors that were made by entry door handles. The rest of room furniture showed good wear and tear as well. Bathroom was dated and water tended to leak on the floor from under the bathtub when one showered, no matter how careful you tried to avoid it. Our interpreter told us that this hotel had a "domestic" 4-star rating, not international. We decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant on the 16th floor. The staff did not speak English. The menu had the usual collection of Vietnamese dishes with some Western food items. The food was probably the highlight of our stay. It was prepared well. It was a bit uncomfortable to be the only customers in the restaurant even though it was the usual dinner time. I guess this is due to relatively high prices at the restaurant. Breakfast was the worst of all the hotels we stayed at. Very limited selection even by local standards, more than usual amount of insects on food trays, staff that had to be told to replace empty trays with full ones all made up for an unpleasant breakfast experience. The coffee was so bad, that I had to ask for a cup of hot water and use instant coffee packets that I brought just in case. Unfortunately, there are few choices in this town for western standards accommodations and it shows.

Title: Simple, good view
Review: This hotel in Quang Ngai, it owned by the government. The hotel has a good view to the river, the room is simple but tidy. The staff are nice but breakfast is not so good. The surrounding area is quiet and there is a night market near the river bank.

Title: Riverside Dinner
Review: Ate sea food Hot Pot here and drank beer while watching the coloured lights from the bridges flicker on the rive ...its as nice a spot as you might find in Quang Ngai. Staff tried hard and some spoke OK English...enough to assure my dining companion there were no Snails included (!!). They do have English langauge menu and wester style food available. Food was quite good with fresh squid, prawns and King fish all going into the pot. Later the atmosphere changed as the 3 VIP rooms warmed up and began to belt out the obligatory Karaoke...either amusing local touch or an annoyance according to your tolerance level. A nice spot...better food available in town...

Title: Good hotel in a non-touristic site
Review: I stayed two nights with my daughter in a River View Twin room ( This is a good hotel with basic services, considering that Quang Ngai is not a touristic site such as Hoi An or Da Nang. The view of the river and the bridge from the room was great. The staff at the reception did not speak English so well and did not seem to understand the booking system via Expedia. He did not even understand what a credit card was. He said the Riverview Twin was not available, though I showed him the printed page of Expedia that says I had booked for a Twin instead of Double. After a couple of minutes' talk on a phone, however, he said a Twin is available. I guess this staff was not a regular one, because it was Sunday. Maybe he got nervous facing an unexpected guests who looked like him but do not speak Vietnamese (I'm Japanese). The staff on the next 2 days spoke English and everything went OK. They accepted my credit card. They serve good free buffet style breakfast. I especially liked their strong coffee. Dinner is good as well and inexpensive. The restaurant staff did not speak English well, but they were nice. Overall, this was a good hotel, admitting that you cannot expect a service in big cities.

Title: Not deserved with 3 stars
Review: Used to stay at this hotel several years before and found it was a good hotel, some 3.5 stars. Coming back this time and was so disappointed. The hotel is degraded too much and only deserve 2 stars. The ameneties are so inferior. Stayed at the 9th floor and the water shower is too weak that I hardly completed my bath. Can hear everything outside when stay in room. Plus they have a party or wedding or the like that make it too noisy the whole evening.

Title: Amazing worse-for-wear 1999 LUXURY rooms going for a song
Review: Lighting: EXCELLENT room lighting, both through outside light and room lighting fixtures. WiFi: FABULOUS. Connects instantly and kept going FAST throughout a two day stay without even slowing down once. Cleanliness: Yes, the carpet definitely could use a steam cleaning and there are spots in the bathroom the cleaner missed. But no one ever complains about planes being much dirtier ;-) Hot Water: Instant and boiling HOT if so desired. Neighbourhood: The local evening restaurant alley is right outside the hotel at the river front. One restaurant next to the other (starting at 5 pm) and a local night market (NOT created for tourists) is maybe 150 meters down the river. Sample the local life and cuisine! The Son My/My Lai Massacre Memorial is an easy 20 minute ride away. Quang Ngai is delightfully unspoiled by tourism. Comfort: I'm sure there are those unwilling to put up with a few issues, like dirty carpets and an undefinable very slight smell in the room (It might just be the city air but it is easily erased by running a/c on a not too cold setting). The bed and bedding are super comfortable. Personally I liked my room so much that I decided to forget about my originally planned destination to stay an extra day here. Staff: GREAT! Given that this is not a tourist hotel, the level of English spoken is surprisingly high, e.g. "may I clean your room now?". The staff tries hard but be prepared to use Google Translate if the occasion requires it. All staff without exception were super friendly and tried hard to keep this guest happy. Cam On Nhieu!

Title: Terrible Hotel - Avoid if possible
Review: Quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. This was prebooked as part of a tour. The first room we were shown to had a soaking wet carpet where the AC was dripping, the ceiling was black with mould, it smelt stale, marks on the walls and dirty carpet. When I complained, we were shown a similar room, except the AC wasn't dripping ( but there was a huge gap around the door!) - Not being able to speak Vietnamese, I couldn't be bothered to ague further so just accepted the room don't be fooled by the relatively fancy looking entrance / reception - once inside its a horror story!!!

Title: Not worth the price
Review: I had a good sized room with traditional hallway, lots of closet space separate bathroom, queen sized bed and importantly good mattress. It was quiet from the rooms around but I was in the front the noise from the street was loud. Nice long desk with good drawers. Laminate floor. That's about it. The cleaning staff cleans the floors with a mop and no cleaning soap. They drag around a bucket with more and more dirt that collects in the mop. Basically they move dirt around never clean anything. Small bugs especially at night flying around, like sand fly sized bugs. I found mouse poop when I moved the bed sideways to get more room on one side. Title: Easy to find with very helpful English speaking staff
Review: We picked this hotel off the internet because it looked to be the best place in Quang Ngai. It was easy to find, which is a plus, since we were traveling by motorbike and needed a place to stay on the way to Hoi An. For the price, we had been expecting a small place with no restaurant and non English speaking staff--so this place was a very pleasant surprise. The hotel was large and clean from the outside and the desk staff was incredibly friendly. The desk staff consisted of 2 pleasant young ladies-both had a firm grasp of English. Even the doorman spoke to me in English. Our room was more than adequate with a comfy livingroom area, bed, and a big bathtub in the bathroom. Nothing fancy, but clean. We chose to have room service, but upon phoning and not being understood, my husband decided to just go collect wine and menus from the restaurant. He ordered a botle of wine to take and told them he might get a different wine later. 15 minutes after he returned, room service showed up with the with the 2nd bottle....we decided to just keep it. The food brought later was fine--not fantastic, but not bad. The walls were a little thin so we could hear a crying baby in a nearby room (fortunately not for long) and some traffic noise. The continental breakfast was very good with plenty of coffee, tea and fruit juice available on the table. We didn't have time to try the pool, but took a look and it was sparkling blue and clean. We had a little trouble with the housekeeping staff in the morning. They showed up about 9am and couldn't speak any English. My husband was trying to tell them to come back later after we checked out, but they didn't understand and came in anyway. I called the front desk and asked them to tell the girls to leave. I had to bring one of the housekeepers to the phone in order for the front desk to tell them to come back later. We chalked this up to a VN quirk as this was the 2nd place we'd stayed where they didn't seem to understand the concept of waiting until people checked out. Why clean the rooms just to have to come back and clean again in a few hours? All in all, these were great people and everything was at least acceptable...and the price was right:)

Well when we came back we discovered that our dirtry clothes was missing. We looked everywere in the room and then we called reception. They said they are being washed. (In the room there is a document which requires the guest signature and items to be recorded before it leaves the room otherwise the hotel is not responsible). We did not complete this form and they took it without our permission. Once we called the Front Desk and we explained they returned our clothes to the room and they were still wet. It was a huge insult that they took something without our permission and return it to us worse and we had to dry our clothes. (Since this was our last day of our trip there was no need to wash anything, since we could do it ourselves the following day in our home town.) Well, this is only 2.30pm and we have been here less than 24 hours and we have 24 more hours left. I hope nothing else goes bad. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world, but its amazing how they are allowed to class this hotel a 4* when it looks, smells and feels like a 1 or maybe 2 star hotel. They state they have a swimming pool. When I seen the pool I wanted to go back to the room. It looks like no-one has been in it for over a year and a very strange colour. Maybe it has not been cleaned in a long time???? Lastly, I can say that we met a nice Gentleman from Ho Chi Minh City. It was brough to our attention that he was brought here to improve the hotel's image and facilities. He did make us feel more welcome and he was very plesant. I wish him the best of luck and hope we can do something and help the hotel improve their image and facilities. Hopefully if I have to come back I can write a positive review after the changes have been made. All of the staff at the reception and the restaurant was helpful and friendly. If you have any questions feel free to contact me at OK... Since my 1st review could not go through since TA could not find the hotel I have tried again. If you remember we was charged an extra 10,000 dong for the orange juice. The representative from Ho Chi Minh City assured us he would take care of the problem and we will only have to pay which is written in the menu for the next occasion. In the final night we had a group dinner for about 13 people. Some of these people had orange juice. Well..... when I recieved the charges, they decided to charge us 25,000 dong this time. So it went from 10,000 to 20,000 and now 25,000. When I asked why, they replied because they had to use an extra orange to make the juice. Can you believe this??? They did not ask us if it was ok, but they just did it. The matter is that based on previous problems you would think they would not make problems worse. it is not about the money but the idea were they don't know the first thing about customer service and the way business should be run. 2. On the check out the bill was to be paid by credit card, which when we checked in they said they accept. When we checked out the person on the front desk said the machine is not working and we have to pay another way. At this time I have no money and no PIN. Eventually she calls a manager from Ho Chi Minh City and he takes 15 seconds and swipes the card and it is authorsied. I assume that she does not have a clue how to swipe the card and just says to guests that its out of order. To make the special close of our trip she makes an error and charges us too much. We decided to sign the transaction and have a refund in cash in local currency. If you go to this hotel, don't pay more than what is advertised. Title: Ridiculously loud, not suitable to spend the night
Review: The day was great here -loved the beach, loved the open bar area and the music was at a nice volume and nice tunes. Didn't really like the cafeteria style food situation, and the whole queue in two different places just to get a beer was a bit annoying. In the morning I ordered beef noodles and after half an hour just cancelled them as it seemed everyone around us was getting served ahead of us and the staff were disorganised. From sundown it turned into a horrible, loud techno nightmare. We asked repeatedly for the music to be turned down. Our hut with our two babies was right next to the decks so when I finally took them to bed, the whole bed and room was shaking with the bass. We were told it would be turned off at 10pm, then midnight, then finally some of our group got the general manager involved and it was turned down to a reasonable volume. Classic example of organisers / DJ thinking that the maximum volume the amps are capable of, is the volume that should be used. No matter how horrible it is for the people trying to eat dinner, chat to their mates or sleep. I don't think this place really knows what it wants to be. The day and night vibes are completely different. I would say this is a terrible place to spend the night with a family, but even when I was single and with friends I would've hated the music and the volume that we were subjected to. Think there needs to be a warning to guests that basically, they won't get ANY sleep on Saturday nights. If you can be bothered to drive 5 hours from HCMC to spend the day here and then get out quickly before the music cranks up, go for it. Otherwise I would look elsewhere

Title: Really cool, lots going on
Review: I'm really surprised Coco Beach Camp has such a low score, at the time of writing this review anyway. For an accommodation, this place has a lot going on: variety of rooms (tents, teepees, bungalows of different sizes), a large restaurant, a separate bar, LOTS of seating and lounging areas, many toilets and showers, a dance stage, music day and night, a beach shop, the beach! Title: A friendly place with nice music, pool and cool breeze

Title: Last summer trip
Review: I have a 2 days 1 night at Coco Beach Camp on Aug 23rd with my beties. We bought round ticket of shuttle bus of Coco. 29-seats bus is new and the drivers was very nice. Because we went on normal day so just three of us on the bus. I planed to stay in tent but staffs said that if we book the beach hut near the beach, they will not charge for the third person stayed in room( you will have 2 tickets for breakfast and 2 tickets for swimming pool). So we decided to book it and we absolutely satisfied of our decision. The house we stayed was really nice and clean, it had air-conditioning inside. I love the colorful of beach hut and some items put on the beach for people to take photos. About the food, there was a restaurant served some food that we had dinner and lunch here. The food is ok, the price is a little bit expensive but we accepted. I recommended that anyone want to relax and find quite place shouldn't go on weekend because i have heard that it's vert crowded. I went on normal day so not many people here. We had taken lots of picture and had a great time here. Enjoy your trip.

Title: Bad service ever! Don't stay here!
Review: I just stayed here 1 day for Western new year 2016 and I wonder why this resort had been rated so high in TripAdvisor?! I booked this resort because it is the only 3stars resort have many rooms left at this time in Phan Thiet, Binh Thuan. When we just arrived at the front door around 10pm, the receptionist walked to our car, she askes my name and said that the hotel did not have any booking for me. I asked for parking and asked her to check with my booking number and she confirmed by then. Do you think this called good service? I don't think so. I have been stayed at room 506- Green Hill garden view. The room was very dirty seem no one stay there in long long time. The furniture are all dirty and the shower in bathroom couldn't run normally. We also couldn't used WiFi, either the television and the telephone was damaged, too!!! The receptionist area was too far from our room (this is huge resort, they use bicycle to travel around). We also though we don't have much time to wait for their fixing. crazy!!! The breakfast was unforgettable because of its terrible!!! If you wanna save cost, you should prepared less but good quality! I noted that I am easy going person. I travel a lot every year. I stayed in many hotels but this is the worse, so I must leave my comment here. The price was too high if you compare with the services this resort can bring. And no service around the resort, too. Remember that many resorts in Phan Thiet, Binh Thuan with lower price and better service to choice! I had just wanna get off this resort as soon as possible. Never back again!

Title: It's ok for La Gi area
Review: We had to stay somewhere as we were visiting family in the area, this was near family and only decent looking place in the area so we tried it. We had a very bad experience with another place in 2010 so we needed a place that was clean with some food options. This is a typical Vietnamese run resort. It's nice and rooms are decent but I had a cricket under my bed the whole time. Like typically Vietnamese run facilities, they do not want to use energy if they don't have to, when you enter your run, it's humid and musty and you need to open A/C immediately. They will NOT turn on hot water pressure, we had to call them 3x's and finally, they knew we were pissed. Also, it's near a beach, so beware of mosquitos in your room, we had to kill alot of them. Restaurant onsite is ok, some decent food, breakfast is free but it's so basic. Dinner menu is good if you pick correct item. Didn't get to enjoy the pool or tennis courts. Beware, you have to pay for those as well. Location is still about another hour or two from Mui Ne or Phan Thiet so be aware of that. All in all, stayed two nights, survived. For the price, you get what you pay for.

Title: Nice and friendly staff, old room, renovation needed
Review: We stayed here in 2 nights. Like other resorts, Lazi Beach resort or Mom Da Chim is quiet and full of trees. It didn't give us a Wow to us, in fact. We stayed at SeaView Superior room, and you may think that you can see the sea in front of your eye; in fact, the sea is far away from the room, and you must pass all the field, trees and bush to see the sea. Recommend deluxe room or bungalow if you want to have a sea view in real!!! :) The room looks old, especially the bathroom. They claim 4 stars for the resort but I think it should be around 2. The water is weak and you should stop using the shower if someone uses the lavabo. The landscape is not taken care well, I think. It may be well cared at the center area but not at the area we stayed. The beach is nice, clean and natural with sand and rocks around. They did not do much for the beach like decoration; but I love that natural beauty. In the morning, you can see local people go fishing on the beach to catch a special fish which live around the rocks. The service is good in overall. The staffs are very nice, friendly and supportive. They are well trained, and they have the hospitality and friendliness that you can see from most local people here. I love that nature and hope the tourist industry will not change them so fast like other big cities. They have swimming pools in fresh water and salt water as well. They are with nice decoration and staffs are around to help you. The food is nice, fresh and a little more expensive than other local restaurant, of course. Let's try Láº©u Tháº£, a signature dish here, which is with fresh fish, vegetable and meat with sour soup. You can try the spa as well, but don't expect too much. Lastly, the resort is around 10 kms from the town center. So, let's take a taxi to the center if you want to enjoy in the evening; for your safety. There is a church 3 km from the resort as well.

Title: You Get What You Pay For
Review: As a caveat, we ended up at this hotel because we were desperate. We were riding a motorcycle from Ho Chi Minh City towards Mui Ne and night had fallen. We booked the cheapest available room with no knowledge of how the rest of the hotel even looked. Our room was what we'd paid for. The room felt like a hotel from the early 1990's, tired old bathroom with two shower offerings, one broken and the other not, worn furnishing and even the tv was of the tube variety. The hotel was also eerily quiet, it's likely that we were the only guests in the hotel that night and that's a really creepy feeling. Beggars can't be choosers was our thinking. The next morning to our amazement and surprise, the hotel looked like a wonderful resort -- there were these big villa-like rooms scattered around the compound (again, we got what we paid for). We had a really delicious breakfast and walked around the beach before heading out.

Title: Great dishes and accommodation
Review: The resort own excellent cook that served us great meals than any we have tasted before. It's good places to enjoy seafood in Vietnam style or your style in simple ways and naturally taste. The resort is beautiful and fresh with tree and gardening. It's very near the beach for great photos.

Title: only stay here if you are part of a large group
Review: This is a good hotel for school groups or team building workers as there is no regard for singles or couples. They may put you in a room away from the main areas but do not care about the loud speakers turned up to super high during dinner. If you wish to have a stomach churning dinner with amateur karaoke music, come here, this is the place.I have never experienced this kind of rudeness before.Nothing was done when I complained to the group. It was only after using simple language at reception, that i managed to convey this and music was turned down. Because the front desk speaks minimal English, it is difficult to ask for anything. On arrival there were empty cans and cigarette butts to greet us at the planter box outside the room. Rubbish bins are overflowing down at the beach and there is garbage everywhere. You would think with all the employees there, they would make an effort.I guess LAZY is an apt description.The only guy working non stop was the pool man but what the pool needs is resurfacing as it has shrunk away from the sides.Instead of spending money on repairs, they have stuck duct tape on these areas.A bandaid approach. This is such a shame because the room was lovely ( curtains falling off and so clear that you are up at sunrise) the grounds are lovely and the location right on the beach. Not certain but i think there were sandflies out and about as well.Breakfast was varied and tasty.

Title: Would be a great place to go to write
Review: Like the other review on trip advisor the service at the bar isn't great, but the place is deserted, our group were the only guest in the whole resort The food in the restaurant though is some of the best we've had in Vietnam. The rooms are very large and spacious with balconies. Vaulted ceilings with lots of natural light. The pool was clean and protected from the wind. The beach access is great and scenic. We were only there for one night but I'd highly recommend this place for anyone literally wanting to get away from it all and everyone else!

Title: Staff everywhere but service poor
Review: Arrived mid afternoon and we were looking forward to a swim given the hot conditions. The pool water was very warm and there were quartz pebbles from the garden beds scattered on the pool floor which we kept stepping on. There were plenty of staff standing around who could have cleaned the pool but obviously couldn't be bothered. It was also difficult to rouse someone to order a drink from the bar. Our room was okay, but we couldn't shut the cedar blinds on the bathroom windows so we were forced to shower in the dark so that people outside could not see in when the lights were on at night time. We are quick to leave tips when the service is good but we kept our cash in our pockets here.

Title: Sleek, modern and super clean hotel in Lagi
Review: This hotel was recently opened and for sure it's the best in Lagi! The hotel offers very nice, cozy, super clean and tastefully decorated room ! Title: A great example of good management
Review: My coastie experience of Vietnam has had a gap and that is the area between Ke Ga and La Gi. Both these places are on the coastal road between Vung Tau and Phan Thiet, some hundreds of kilometres long. This trip I ventured out to Mien Dong bus station in HCMC and took the La Gi public bus (Dong 20000). A word of advice, this bus is not air conditioned and is mainly for the use of locals. The La Gi terminus requires a short taxi ride to the Thanh Binh which I had reserved from the Elios Hotel in HCMC on the basis of the small number of reviews on these pages. La Gi is not a town flush with English speakers and it was a pleasant surprise to find that the owners son Diem who now manages the Hotel, spoke excellent English and made me most welcome. The Hotel has been upgraded by Diem and his team and is a very professional outfit. The premises are modern but traditional, spotless, the staff extremely pleasant and the premises position in town lends itself to an easy stroll to the market or river. The big surprise came when I tried to get a late lunch. I could not find anywhere to get a feed and thought this was going to be a night of potato crisps. But no-around sunset little street carts popped up everywhere and it is clear that this is a favourite pastime of the residents. Right opposite Thanh Binh was one such cart so at Diem's recommendation that's where I headed. I ordered a chicken rice noodle soup with salad vegies and a beer. The beer came in VN manner with a glass of ice, so being over the road from Thanh Binh Diem came to my rescue with a glass of his own "verified" ice. Cost of this meal ,which was filling and delicious was Dong 50000 including the beer. A great meal and a cool beer for $2.50 is hard to get these days ! Whilst there I walked out to the beach which is about 4kms and unlike most of VN coastline found that the rubbish or pollution was non existent despite the beach having hundreds of locals swimming and attending the food shacks right on the beach. I was impressed by the resolve that Diem and his team have for building a sustainable business based on good clean accommodation, fair around the year pricing and a desire to keep La Gi a low key interesting place for westerners to enjoy a look at how life is for locals, whilst providing a laid-back short break on the otherwise well trodden tourism paths of VN. Accommodation for me as a single was a large double room, with window, aircon, ensuite bathroom, all linen, and breakfast served in your own room all for Dong 260000 or $13. Value plus!! Bus to Phan Thiet and on to Ham Tien, Mui Ne and Soui Nouc is 50 metres from hotel. Fare to Ham Tien, Dong 33000 or $1.50

Title: Perfect Local Stay
Review: If you are a Viet Kieu visiting family in the area, this is a perfect basic place to hang your hat and get a rejuvenated night of sleep after those long and hot hours visiting family and friends, and doing local shopping. We did just that in July 2013 for over one week and would stay again should opportunity comes our way. Everything works... electricity, lighting, air conditioner, TV, hot water, toilet and sink drainage. Rooms are not big nor fancy but spectacularly clean, no mildew in bathroom, and no bugs. Hot water is unlimited as they use the on-demand electric type. House staff is helpful and courteous. We especially enjoyed spending the early morning on the hotel's roof top balcony/deck sipping ice coffee and watching the rising sun while listening to the town comes to life... the beep beep sound of motorcycle horns is hard to forget. (Rotan furniture would be a bit nicer and certainly more comfortable than the standard concrete bench). Best Regards!

Title: Alright for only a one night stay
Review: Pros - good airconditioning, excellent wifi, clean bathrooms, soft beds ;), pretty good view. Cons - bad location (there's not much entertainment around the area unless you are there for the food and to kick back). That's pretty much it. Oh, and by the way heads up for the people are going I come here. Remember to being your own tooth paste because when I used the hotel's it was some cheap one that made my whole tongue go numb after I used it.

Title: Comfortable stay
Review: First of all, I should couch that prior coming to the Thanh Binh Hotel, my husband and I stayed at the Sheraton in Nha Trang so this may have coloured our view of the hotel. We were in La Gi to visit family and my auntie organised this hotel as the best one in town. This was a big family trip back home with aunts and uncles and parents and siblings in tow so my family had most of the hotel booked. My room was on the top most floor and these rooms do not have a hot water system so we were relegated to cold showers. My parents and my brother and his wife had a room on the 3rd floor and these did have hot water systems so they had ample water and we all used their shower,. When I asked hotel management why this was the case they informed me that they ran out of hot water systems once they got to level 4! The wifi in the hotel is fantastic and the balcony on the top floor is amazing. Even on hot days there is a wonderfully cool breeze that goes through. I would grab some food from a street vendor and take it up to the balcony to enjoy the tranquility. LaGi really is off the beaten path and if it were not my family village then I would not choose to go there. However in saying that, I do love the food from the street vendors there and did not have a single bad meal. Just be prepared to supplement this with immodium as well :)

Title: a seriously good provincial hotel
Review: My wife and I stayed at the Binh Thanh for three nights in December, 2011. Like DarwinAustralia, we like to get off the beaten path. Our experience confirmed Darwin's post in most important respects. Important to stress: La Gi is not a resort town. It is a middle-sized town in an obscure coastal province, not particularly charming nor clean. Fishing is the big business here; tourism hardly counts. That may change -- a huge new resort was under construction several kilometers north of the town. When we visited, however, the only folks on the beach were local. We had a marvellous meal of freshly caught crabs, charcoal-grilled shrimp and squid at Can Binh beach (15 minutes from town to the south) on a Sunday. We were told that vendors are scarce there except on weekends and holidays, however. Can Binh Beach was not as clean as Darwin reported. The next day (Monday) we were disappointed by the beach restaurants at the beach to the north. The staff of the Thanh Binh hotel are friendly and helpful. They happily provided an extra table and chairs and the hot water bottle that we requested. I rated 'sleep quality' only average because, though the beds were fine, there was considerable road noise and some invasive biting bugs the night we left windows open. In general, the rooms are well-appointed and well-maintained. There was plenty of hot water but (as is common in Vietnam), no way to keep the shower water off the floor of the bathroom. The hotel is a ten minute walk from the market and fishing port. Non-Vietnamese speakers may have difficulty foraging for meals, especially near the hotel. La Gi Town has plenty of sidewalk vendors and market stalls but few real restaurants. We urged the Thanh Binh management to consider providing breakfast. We got to La Gi by taking a bus from Nha Trang that after seven long hours dropped us at 'Nga Ba 46', where the branch highway to La Gi meets Highway 1. From there, it was a 45 minute ride by local bus. Travelling onward, with the help of our friends at the Binh Thanh, we were booked on a large van that took us comfortably, directly and somewhat speedily (4 hours) to our hotel in Saigon.

Title: Fantastic, Clean Friendly Hotel in Lagi. (Lagi is yet to be discovered by Tourists)
Review: There are only a mere handful of Hotels in Lagi, and I think this one is the best. I have stayed at this hotel annually for past 4 years. It is a modern hotel and well constructed. Has a lift, but you have to first go up the stairs to get to it. Alternatively, you go down the ramp to the undercover car-park/basement and catch the lift from there. Only a small number of the staff speak moderate English, but considering how very very few across Lagi speak any English, this is a bonus. Good free WiFi and TV reception. Fridge in each room. The Rooms are serviced daily and always clean and tidy. Rooms are very spacious. Rooms on eastern side of building have small private balconies. Lagi has inherent problems with electricity coming and going. This Hotel is as far as I know, the only hotel in Lagi with a back-up generator. All of that for just $10 a night per room. What I love is the balcony on the top floor. You can look out over the ocean, but the added bonus is at that height (4th floor), you get a lovely cool breeze each afternoon and evening. I have spent many an evening up there with a few cold beer in the company of good friends. I find all of the people in Lagi very warm and friendly to foreigners, and to note, when you visit, you may in fact be the only Caucasians in the whole town. Some, particularly the children want to stare at you and touch. Particularly the blue eyed blond visitors. You need to go to Lagi NOW before developers find it and move in. Lagi is a very small coastal town that has fishing as it's main industry. It is located some 45 kilometres south of Phan Thiet. From 10 to 120 kilomteres north of Lagi are a number of resorts that foreigners are really yet to discover, however are a considerable distance north and apart from the resorts themselves, there are no local services, shops or things to do. Also, many are unfinished projects. Back at Lagi..... Within 10 minutes by motorbike or taxi to the south of Lagi is the the most incredible beach called Can Binh. It is a big long and wide beach of white sand with minimal washed up pollution. Along the beach front are tented or sheltered areas under coastal pine trees. Behind them are a couple of cook-houses that service the beach front. You take yourself under one of the shelters at the beach, sit back in a deck chair and the coo-house staff will bring you bundle of beers and ice and keep bringing more as requested. From the cook-houses they will deliver fantastic Vietnamese food in abundance on the plates but very little on the wallet. When in season, prawns, crabs and lobsters are at huge sizes. Imagine four Tiger Prawns to the kilo. The catch is live in tanks and cooked fresh for you. There is almost no surf and you would need go out in the water near 100 metres before you reach chest depth. Great place for small kids. The beach is very popular with the Vietnamese locals and very much a family place to be. Within 5 minutes from Lagi town centre is Lagi Beach itself. Not much sand at high tide, but at low tide the beach is very wide. Lots of food stands on the beach, but sadly, the beach is very polluted with washed up debri and that of which the locals dump on the beach. WHAT TO DO IN LAGI : A trip to the wharves at sunrise is a must. All the colorful trawlers coming in and dividing up the catch on the wharf. Wholesalers sort their catch in the nearby sheds with local marketers setting up shop on the wharf. An incredible variety of fish are to be seen with some you will have never laid eyes on except on a National Geographic documentary. Some really weird fish come out of the sea. Last visit I was there I saw a huge Manta Ray on the wharf which would have been 2 metres across. A MUST DO: Go to the wharves, select a couple big fresh fish (Tuna, Mackerel or some type of coral fish for just a few dollars), and take back to the Thanh Binh and ask the hotel staff to cook it for you and you it share with them for dinner, and they bring the vegetables and salad.. You need to pre-arrange this with them. Alternatively, do the same with one of the 4 or 5 cafes across the street. FARMING : Lagi is surrounded by rice farms, dragon fruit plantations and prawn farms. You will need to rent a motorbike or hire a taxi as there are no tourist services in Lagi. BUDDHIST TEMPLE AND EDUCATION CENTRE: Currently under construction (about 50% finished as at June 2011) is a huge centre perhaps no more than 25 to 35 minutes walk from the Thanh Binh Hotel. The roof of the main complex is being gilded in pure gold. COFFEE : While not grown locally, it is very much part of the local town. Coffee shops are everywhere. Very cheap and apart from getting a coffee in Dalat itself, this would have to be the best cup of coffee in all of Vietnam. There are perhaps a dozen large coffee shops, each located on 2 acre (1 hectare) blocks of land with gardens. NIGHTLIFE : There is a single nightclub that has opened that gives live music of both Vietnamese modern rock and also the western classics. (Ever heard "Stairway to Heaven" sung with a Vietnamese accent?) BULLOCK WAGONS: Throughout Lagi, bullocks towing carts are to bee seen all over the place. They deliver everything from, ice, to fish, to timber, to construction materials. A real sight to see. LOCAL MARKET: Can not beat it. If you think Saigon shopping is cheap, try Lagi. As much as 50% or more cheaper than in Saigon. (Try silk ties for a dollar or denim jeans for $5) GETTING THERE: You could taken an open bus to Phan Thiet and try to find a way back south, however (email me for contact details), there is a mini bus service that leaves Saigon every 2 hours going directly to Lagi with one comfort stop along the way. Costs just 100,000 dong per person and will drop you off at the door of the hotel. Language is a problem, so have the hotel book for you. Takes between 3 to 5 hours to get there subject to traffic. When in Lagi, you need to rent a motor bike ($4 a day) or hire a taxi to get around. Costs only $2 for the local bus from Lagi to Phan Thiet. I am very happy to receive e-mails to assist you in visiting Lagi, however, I do not visit the Trip Advisor site so often, so may be a week or two before I can reply.

Title: Not recommended
Review: Nice outdoor area around the pool and modern AC in the room in main house, but about everything else is better in coconut camp just next door. Had to pay up front, "breakfast" is a joke, fried egg and a lemonade and no free coffee, and neither transfer to resort included nor could any arrangements be made by non-english speaking staff. Room was beaten up, dirty and had a mouldy bathroom, little tiny antlike bugs running around the table - nothing that would normally disturb me much but at the price of 25$ we had much better places before. Alas, coconut camp next door offers a good restaurant, a nice bar and helpful staff and is a much nicer place to consider - the shared bathrooms were very clean and we would have moved there if we had stayed longer.

Title: Fails to provide the primary requirement of a hotel
Review: First the positives. The location is great...right across from the pier where the ferry comes in. Views from the front rooms we had were spectacular. Check in and check out were efficient and we had no issues. Now the two negatives. The primary function of a hotel is to provide a guest with a good night's sleep. This is impossible due to the bedding supplied. The beds were like sleeping on a timber deck. They creaked terribly every time someone turned even slightly. Pillows were incredibly thin and useless as a pillow. None of us got much sleep as a result. The second negative was the older man who sat at the table just inside the entrance to the hotel and glared insolently at us every time we arrived or left. I think he may have been the patriarch of the family. It was really unsettling and made us feel unwelcome. There were other things too...like only 2 towels supplied in a family room for 4 adults and only one small water supplied. Hot water was non existent. I couldn't stay there another night.

Title: Beautiful place near Ben Tre
Review: The location is perfect for resting and enjoying a beautiful landscape in the Mekong Delta. The great swimming pool, surrounded by garden, contributed to the excellent rest. Breakfast was good and the staff, in particular in the restaurant, was very friendly and helpful. Congratulations! Our room was very comfortable and ample although its interior decoration was a step behind all the rest. The hotel provides a trail map for cycling, but not for walking. There could be more information about hiking trails, not least because the surrounding area of coconut palms and rice fields really deserves a visit (which, however, without a map or clear indications, may not be easy).

Title: Perfect, peaceful location, excellent accommodation
Review: We had a three night stay and would have loved to stay longer. On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff, who brought us a welcome drink and informed us that we had been given a free room upgrade, which was a lovely surprise. We were driven round to our room in a golf buggy and were taken past the various on site facilities. Our room was nice and spacious, with a shaded veranda that looked onto the beautiful garden and pool. We had a well stocked mini bar and complimentary fresh fruit selection. We had a huge open air bathroom with a bathtub and separate shower. We had a very laid back time during our stay; swung around in a hammock reading, explored the nearby lanes on complimentary push bikes, enjoyed happy hour drinks while playing board games at the bar overlooking the sleepy river, wandered around the lovely gardens checking out the homegrown fruit and vegetables, splashed in the pool. We also booked on the two hour sunset river cruise, which was well worth it. A great opportunity to observe river life and the industries underway - mostly the various stages of coconut charcoal production. We had all our meals on site. The breakfast was an excellent selection, mostly buffet style, with pho and eggs cooked to order. The evening meals were excellent too, with a wide range of dishes to choose from. All the staff were really friendly and efficient and most spoke excellent English. Check out went smoothly and they arranged a taxi to the bus station for us. I would rate our stay here as one of the best during our two months in Vietnam, I only wish we could have stayed longer!

Title: Good but some improvements needed
Review: Itâ€™s really hard to decide how to rate this property. So firstly the good points: The location is lovely right on the riverfront & with well kept gardens. The pool area is great & was really peaceful- no blaring music. The service is great- the staff are friendly, helpful & attentive. The bed was really comfortable. The breakfast is very good. The day tour was excellent. The guide was a lovely girl who spoke good English. Now the not so good: The room we had (Longan) is best described as rustic- what that actually means is shuttered doors locked by padlock, no safe, really dodgy electrics & an awful shower. There is however a fridge, kettle & tea/coffee making facilities. The other negative we felt was the lunch/ dinner menu. Basically most main courses were priced at 140,000 dong and we thought the food was average at best. Some extra items for lunch such as bahn mi would have been welcomed. I think this place is doing well because of the wonderful surroundings but the quality of the accommodations needs improving. It is really easy & cheap to get here from Saigon on the bus (70,000 dong) & a shuttle bus is provided from the bus station to the hotel on both the outgoing & return journey.

Title: Not as nice as I thought it would be
Review: Such a shame. This resort should have had no trouble getting five stars from me, but it doesnâ€™t measure up in many ways. It has a beautiful setting, lovely open air restaurant and bar, and a friendly, helpful, and usually - but not always - attentive staff. Others have noted that the rooms are basic or rustic; I might add the words rundown and neglected to characterize the entire resort. We actually stayed in two different rooms in order to squeeze in a three night reservation. The first was one of their standard rooms. The wallpaper was faded and peeling, the plaster cracked, and the curtains were threadbare and falling down. The second, a suite room was better and we really liked the semi open air bathroom with tub and shower, even though the accompanying garden was quite sparse. The landscaping is in rough shape. Walkways are all 1 inch crushed stone, the cheapest and least appealing of all walkway solutions, no pavers or even basic concrete. The gardens are choked - make that strangled - with grass and weeds. Flowers barely survive and what were once intended to be hedges are straggly and unkempt. (But the lotus pond was beautiful!). We observed that the resort just does a basic amount of watering and sweeping up of fallen leaves, and that seems to be about it. As I mentioned, the staff was usually attentive, but we sat in the bar area for happy hours one evening and were never asked if we wanted refills. The one attendant sat behind this tall credenza where she could barely be seen glued to her smartphone. We did not book one of their tours. They seemed expensive based upon what weâ€™ve seen elsewhere in our month in Vietnam. Perhaps if we had not already done a river cruise or two we might have been interested. We thought the breakfast was great, but lunch and dinner lacking. Saigon prices without Saigon quality. One night my banana and chocolate crepes came instead with small waffles probably left over from breakfast. Their menu also lacked Western options for when you want a change from the Vietnamese. One small but quite irritating thing is that they charged us 25,000 Dong apiece for eight waters over the course of three days. Probably a 1000% markup when we as a â€œcaptive audienceâ€ had no other choice to stay hydrated. Why not free watering stations with those big five gallon containers and reduce plastic waste by doing so? Our perception is that Ownership is set on maximizing profits (either that or jump starting their cruise business), and not on reinvesting in the property. We were told that the resort is eight years old, I would have guessed much older. On our first afternoon and evening, a Friday, there was very loud (and very bad) karaoke going on directly across the river. It went on for seven straight hours and ruined any chance for peace and solitude. Despite our complaints, we did have a good time, but would likely look for another resort if we ever came back to the Ben Tre area. A couple of other items of note. The two bike rides they suggest are quite good and get you out into the countryside. You canâ€™t avoid a busy stretch on the main road outside the resort, however. Also, the Minh Tam bus service they suggest taking if you donâ€™t want to spring for private transportation worked out quite well. But be prepared that itâ€™s a van from the small Minh Tam bus station in central Saigon, to a bus at a station on the outskirts of Saigon, to another van from the bus station in Ben Tre to the driveway to Mango Home. The bus people took good care of us and Mango Homeâ€™s golf cart was waiting for us when we were dropped off.

Title: Beautiful and relaxing

Title: Absolutely brilliant property! Was exactly what we were looking for! Great facilities, location and outstanding staff!
Review: You've heard the story before. Came for 2 days stayed a week. This was our experience. We had travelled, like many others, from Ha Noi to HCM and we seeking a refuge to relax at and enjoy local activities in the Delta area before moving on to Singapore. We looked on line and in Lonely Planet for a spot and Mango Home repeatedly caught our attention. It seemed to be exactly what we wanted. A nice room, pool, waterside location with things to see and do in the area. Perfect fit for us. From the very beginning we received outstanding service from the owner Jay and all of his staff. Everyone we met was really kind, welcoming, helpful, friendly and looking to do the most professional job they could. Everyone from the guy taking care of the bikes, to the front desk staff to the gardener (seemingly one of the happiest people I've ever seen). As others have noted not everyone spoke completely fluent English but not should they. There are lots of staff working that are capable of helping you and isn't that part of travelling, working through communicating with others? We had no problems with this. We ended up in the Water Lily room and really loved it. Spacious, comfortable and enormous, semi-outdoor bathroom. Exactly what we were looking for. The pool area was lovely, water the right temperature and staff came around at happy hour to get your orders. Great, non-intrusive service. We took the tour from Mango Home and thought it was absolutely great. Not really organized tour kind of people but we found the format and places we went to very interesting. Partly due to the great guy who lead us, Mr. Thuc. A very friendly, calm, knowledgable man who we thoroughly enjoyed meeting and speaking with. He definitely made the tour better. The next day we rode some of the bikes the resort lends out on a tour of the rice fields and back roads around the area. The resort provides a rudimentary map. Loved this. Third day we decided to try another bike ride and had a brilliant time. Rode for hours around the surrounding villages. Met loads of kids yelling hello and stopping to speak to us. Like Thailand in the 80's. This spurred us on to stay several more days and do much of the same. We were invited into houses. Showered with gifts of fruit and conversation. This was the type of thing we'd been craving to do and we finally had found it. The best part, as others have mentioned, is that we could come back to this welcoming, friendly resort to swim, have a cold beer or just chill. The facilities are nice, well taken care of and inviting. This became our daily itinerary. Breakfast, ride, swim, happy hour, hang out with fellow guests, dinner, drinks and sleep. Perfect. Everyone was happy and enjoying the place. The only downside to this entire stay was the extremely unfortunate event noted below. A group of 7 people came into the resort and the entire atmosphere changed. They were loud, abrasive, demeaning and condescending to the staff, in particular their group leader. We felt that all the staff dealt with them in a very calm, professional manner and tried their hardest to understand what the guests wanted and to try to accommodate their many demands. Perhaps there was a difference in cultures and the expectations of the group exceeded the type of property they were staying however this perfect little spot changed immediately. The staff were completely upset at how they were being treated and spoken to. Some were in tears. The management tried their best to accommodate to no avail. We spent much time talking to the staff and assuring them that it was not them in the wrong. Once the group left the resort returned to what it had been before. All in all this was one of our highlights of our trip to Vietnam. We will always fondly remember our stay here. The people we met, both from the resort and the world visitors at happy hour, made this a great place to stay at and come back to. We want to give a special shout outs to: -Mr. Tinh for his friendly smile, helpful demeanor and his patience in understanding what we wanted to do and his helpfulness in helping us achieve that. -Mr. Thuc, thank you very much for all your kind service, knowledgable tour information and for the many great conversations we shared. Congratulations on your impending marriage and both Marlene and I wish you great fortunes in the future and a happy, healthy family. -Ms. Mi, we very much enjoyed speaking with you and learning more about Vietnam from you. -Mr. Huy, Thanks for all your help, humour and conversation. We especially appreciated how you and Mr. Thinh tried your hardest to accommodate that challenging group and restore a sense of calm at the resort. Thank you. -And the gardener. Never caught his name but what a great guy. The gardens are beautiful and he is diligently out there day after day putting together a beautiful array of flowers and plants. He always had time to stop and show us what he was doing and give us a big smile and a thumbs up. Great guy! Marlene and I wish Jay and all his staff the best of luck with their business. You have a great team of people there and a great resort and we know you will continue to provide lifelong memories for others as you have for us. Thank you very much. Dave and Marlene

Title: Room rates a 3; the experience was a 4
Review: The setting along the river is lovely and the gardens are beautiful. Our "garden view" room, however, was pretty basic - perhaps because you should be outside enjoying the grounds and not sitting in your room. The best part of the room was the bathroom, which was outdoors (but covered with high walls) - and almost as big as the sleeping room. The sleeping room lacked anywhere to open your suitcase, so we had to open them on the floor. The mattress was hard foam, but gave an OK sleep. The air-conditioner was a bit noisy. Staff were great. Almost everyone understood and spoke English - at least enough for us to get by - and they enjoyed the opportunity to practice speaking English with us. While the jug of mojitos was a bit watered down, it quenched our thirst and the bar was a great place to sit and watch the boats go by - ditto with the restaurant. Breakfast was not buffet, so we could order what we wanted to eat, which was good. The highlight was our trip with their guide on "Mango Cruise," where we got to glimpse local life on the waterways, visit coconut and brick factories, bike through the countryside, take a sampan down a canal, and generally have a great time. This is definitely worth a day or two - or maybe even more - and is an ideal getaway if you want a quick trip to the countryside from Ho Chi Minh City.

Title: Fantastically relaxing hotel/resort
Review: Fantastic hotel/resort on the banks of a Mekong River tributary. The staff are exceptionally friendly and always trying to help. The room was huge, with an equally huge bathroom, that has a garden growing in it and a hole above in the roof. Very comfortable and air conditioned room (the bathroom is not air conditioned). Not, there may be geckos on the front of the cabin and perhaps spiders and other bugs. None posed any danger. Mosquito nets are available above the beds as well. The facilities are excellent, with a lovely pool, bikes to hire and a large lounge area facing the river. Breakfast is good, lunch and dinner is served until 8.30pm. The meals are fantastic. The staff even organised for a boat to take us across the the coconut factory on the other side of the river when we couldn't join a tour. Run by the same people who organise Mango Tours, but don't wait until you arrive to organise what you want to do. Check the website in advance and book your tour in advance, otherwise you may miss out like we did. They're very popular. All prices are quoted in USD, so they tend to be more expensive than other hotels. But you are paying for comfort, which you definitely get.

Title: UNIQUE, COMFORTABLE AND COMMENDABLE
Review: Stayed here 3 nights. Was looking for a peaceful land based escape in the Mekong Delta. Much of the Delta is heavily industrialised and other parts suffer from an excess of tours groups. Ben Tre Island seems, in most part, to be a happy exception to both scourges - and Mango Home is an excellent base from which to explore. Booked a "suite" at $50 a night. Value for money. Felt private. Room clean, spacious and with good amenities. Nice front porch, and funky part outdoor bathroom at the back. The restaurant/bar area has an excellent river view, even more so at sunset. Comfortable and chilled. Food and drinks are both good quality and served with a smile. Have read other TA reports bemoaning the price of meals. Sure, you can cycle down the lane 10 minutes and buy a bowl of noodles with tripe and liver, breathing in diesel fumes as the trucks honk their way past, and using google translate to understand your order (too late in my case). Or you can pay extra for comfy loungers and a sunset view with english speaking staff who try their best to serve you well (even if they don't always succeed). Choice is yours. But don't relate prices of the one to the other. It's like comparing apples and pears. Free bikes to use. Got lost for a day down avenues of coconut palms and leafy fruit laden lanes, with streams and rivers never far away. Special thanks to "Ben" in the restaurant for making me his special ginger tea and offering me a well tasty pho for breakfast, and to Jay for prompt and informative pre booking advice.
